⊢ (c0 ∈ Reg ↔(KQ ` c0)∈ Reg)
⊣ d(hs0, ⋃ c0)
⊣ d(hs1, c0)
⊣ d(hs1, ⋃ c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg))
-| diffsc(hs1, c0)
-| diffsc(hs1, cuni(c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Reg ↔(KQ ` c0)∈ Reg)
⊣ d(hs1, c0)
⊣ d(hs1, ⋃ c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg))
-| diffsc(hs1, cuni(c0))

comment: The Kolmogorov quotient of a regular space is regular. By ~ regr1 it is also Hausdorff, so we can also say that a space is regular iff the Kolmogorov quotient is regular Hausdorff (T_3). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
